channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. Two contestants attempt to explain away their negative feedback, and one contender finds herself unable to hold back her frustration, before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Brighton couples compete, with the first pair taking a playful approach, the second two aiming for a more personal evening and the last pair livening things up with a Spanish theme.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert returns to help people struggling to sell their homes, beginning in the cathedral cities of Hereford and Gloucester. Nick and Carolyn have recently separated and are desperate to get rid of their house after seven months on the market, while Lorna and Stuart need a bigger place to accommodate their growing family. Phil must persuade the sellers to do what it takes to attract buyers, and get it all done in time for open day.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Ceri and Mike Green choose between the Lake District and the French Alps, with Jonnie Irwin showing them three UK properties and Laura Hamilton choosing a trio across the Channel.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hair and beauty tutor April Richards hosts the first dinner party in Birmingham. She plans a starter of zebra meat, but the dish does not go down well with employment adviser Paz Thakrar, who is a strict vegetarian and thinks that even eating vegetables is cruel.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Scientist John Fennel hosts the second party in Birmingham, and decides to prepare an ambitious menu that makes use of his skills in the lab. His culinary experiments include the use of soda-siphoned fish batter, a specially crafted fire-maker, a tandoor chimney, and ice-cream made with nitrogen oxide.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in Birmingham is hosted by banker Vanessa Being, who describes herself as a brilliant cook. She hopes to impress her guests with a classy menu of lobster, confit of duck, and fried grasshopper canapes, but forgets to cater for a vegetarian diner.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Strict vegetarian Paz Thakrar hosts the penultimate dinner party in Birmingham, but his meat-eating guests show little enthusiasm for the menu and are further displeased by the idea of a karaoke session afterwards.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Insolvency administrator Toni Shukla hosts the final dinner party in Birmingham, and appears to have a good chance of securing the £1,000 prize after her rivals' unsuccessful evenings. However, her lack of cookery knowledge threatens to scupper her hopes of gaining the most points.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of Lela's, a California restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff.(n)

programme.title: How to Live Mortgage Free with Sarah Beeny
programme.desc: The housing expert meets inspiring people who have found a way to live without a mortgage, as they share their secrets on how they liberated themselves from debt. In the first episode, Sarah talks to 27-year-old Annie from Lincolnshire, who transformed an unused industrial site into a house worth over £250,000. She also visits 29-year-old Kimberley, who is desperate to be free of the monthly burden of ever-increasing London rent, and decides to transform a 100-year-old derelict Dutch barge.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: New series. Noel Fitzpatrick and his team return to provide more cutting-edge animal care. The professor's first patient is labradoodle Mitzi, who has been hit by a car - and Noel's biggest concern is that she may have suffered nerve damage, leaving her owners fearing the worst. Options are limited for 10-month-old German pointer Hector, who is struggling to walk - he must undergo spinal surgery or face the prospect of being put to sleep, while a Leonberger with a cancerous leg undergoes an operation to remove the tumour.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Couples include Sarah and Stephen, who were shocked to find out they were expecting twins, and Tasha and Jonny, who went through a traumatic birth with their first child and are planning a Caesarean section to enable them to banish their fears of history repeating itself.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: New series. Some of the UK's most obsessive cleaners head stateside to clean America's mess, with two cleaners staying with their host and immersing themselves in the local culture. In this first episode, obsessive cleaners Tina and Mark fly to Texas to do battle with 70-year-old Patrick's home, spending five days attempting to transform the house which is nestled deep in the Texan countryside. The ranch was once a beautiful family home until Patrick's wife passed away three years ago, since when it has collected clutter, cobwebs and dog poo, and has fallen into a state of disrepair.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This one-off edition of the programme looks at the challenges facing Cheshire's police custody teams, with around 20,000 people passing through their cells every year. Homeless ex-serviceman and repeat offender Michael has been arrested following a complaint about his behaviour in a cinema, but he is just happy to have a roof over his head for the night, while DC Ben Hilton is called out to deal with a case of a woman who has been arrested after stabbing her partner in the leg with a kitchen knife.(n)

programme.title: Confessions of a Junior Doctor
programme.desc: Filmed at the height of the junior doctors' crisis in 2016, this documentary series explores the story of the NHS in unprecedented times, told by some of the 60,000 junior doctors working on the front line in NHS hospitals. Working in every department, from A&E corridors to operating theatres, junior doctors are face increasing pressure as the NHS struggles to cope with the rising number of patients. The first episode follows new graduates as they begin to understand the reality of their new careers.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jessica Hynes and guest captain David Walliams take on Jon Richardson and Rhod Gilbert. Sam Simmons joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including Britain's Got Talent, Nature's Weirdest Event, Doctor Who, First Dates, Culinary Genius and the News.(n)

programme.title: The Super Orgasm
programme.desc: For most women multiple orgasms can seem almost mythical. But some can experience it not once, twice or even 10 times, but 60, 70 or 100 - a super-orgasm. In this documentary, a group of these women volunteer for a series of tests in a scientific investigation to reveal the truth behind the super-orgasm. The aim is to measure and record the phenomenon for the first time, finding out how the brain and the body react before, during and after, and asking if these women are wired differently to other people. And if not, is it something that could be learned by anyone?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton help Victor and Alison Dennis, who plan on winding up their IT business to start a B&B, but cannot decide whether they prefer Cornwall or France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Ceri and Mike Green choose between the Lake District and the French Alps, with Jonnie Irwin showing them three UK properties and Laura Hamilton choosing a trio across the Channel.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Carlisle couple Laura and Stuart Queen choose between relocating to Central Scotland, close to family and work, or Murcia, Spain. Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help them decide.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Chris and Sherrine Kingsley-Smith have spent most of their 14-year marriage travelling the world on a boat but are now ready to drop anchor for dry land. Chris is keen on the rural lifestyle on offer in the Cotswolds where they already have friends, but Sherrine has her heart set on the Dordogne region of France where they're currently renting. Jonnie Irwin tries to keep them in the UK with a budget of £700,000, while Jasmine Harman tempts them with some amazing properties in France for up to £900,000.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of an Italian restaurant in New Jersey, which is struggling due to a cumbersome menu, an unruly kitchen and confused staff. Gordon suggests carefully prepared meatballs will be popular with the clientele, but owner Joe Cerniglia needs to make some big changes.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of a French restaurant in the heart of Moorpark, California. The pompous, over-complicated cuisine is keeping the customers away and there is an imminent threat of bankruptcy. However, the owner is vigorously opposed to change, despite the failings of his current business model.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: New series. Dapper 24-year-old Will is looking for a woman to share his love of the countryside, but he has never had a girlfriend and is not a natural when it comes to chatting up a lady, while lofty long-haired rocker Daniel, aka Squid, strides into the restaurant on a mission to break the rules. Mum-of-two Emma, 47, is all glammed up and ready to play the love lottery, but Cupid throws a huge surprise her way, and when the man who broke her heart walks through the door the drama begins.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The debt collection agents grapple with emotional evictions and moral dilemmas during the festive period, including a young family in Crystal Palace who are made homeless when the landlord repossesses their home because he wants to redevelop the property. The eviction comes as a shock to the family as they are up-to-date with their rent, but have just one hour to gather their belongings. Plus, an acrimonious divorce in Chessington comes to a head when the estranged wife obtains a writ to reclaim the house, and an off-licence owner in Hampshire with unpaid rent of more than £5,000 battles to keep his business open just as everything shuts down for the holidays.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya feels hurt that Toadie still mistrusts her to be around Nell, Jimmy is unhappy with how Leo and Amy are treating each other, while Steph sees a new residential opportunity.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Matt's plans are thrown into chaos when Ellie makes it clear she has no intention of going to Vietnam, while Ash gets a message there is no official record of his brother's death.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: On the eve of Sookie's wedding, an unexpected message from a former girlfriend puts an end to Christopher's night of passion with Lorelai.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lorelai continues to mope over Christopher, until she has an intriguing dream about Luke. Rory returns to town, hoping to get back together with Jess, but a chance encounter makes her realise he may have moved on. Paris is certainly glad to see her again - especially as she needs help in preparing for a date.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away: Busted.
programme.desc: In this special episode, the High Court enforcement agents have to deal with a fraudulent tenant, an evasive debtor and a mother in denial. Steve and Ben are in west London to see a tenant who owes £14,000 in unpaid rent, but when they gain access to the property they discover the house has divided up like a hotel and is being sublet. In Sussex, Brian and Del chase a debt of over £10,000 owed to a van rental business for damaged vehicles, before heading to Kent to try to reclaim £6,000 of unpaid rent from a woman financially dependent on a new partner after a disastrous divorce.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In south London, father-and-son team Del and Dael Anglin face death threats from a debtor's father, after arriving at a property to collect a debt of over £3,500. Meanwhile, in east London, two agents are confronted with a tenant who claims to have had no prior warning that he is being evicted from his tiny bedsit. Del and Brian try to recover £6,000 owed by a London hotel to a catering supply company, and Paul and Steve must tackle a difficult eviction.(n)

programme.title: The Bucket List
programme.desc: Two terminally ill cancer patients, one a wealthy tycoon, the other a penniless mechanic, resolve to enjoy the time they have left to live life to the full. While in hospital, the pair draw up a list of all the things they have always wanted to do but never found the time, before embarking on a mission to try them all. Comedy, starring Jack Nicholson, Morgan Freeman, Sean Hayes and Beverly Todd.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: The Australian drama returns four months on from the events of the previous series, with Vera taking over as governor of the rebuilt prison and Will as her deputy. Bea discovers that Kaz Proctor, the leader of feminist vigilante group the Red Right Hand, has built up quite a following among the women - and whereas Bea was once their inspiration, they now view her as a traitor. However, a far greater enemy is also back. The Freak herself, deranged former governor Joan Ferguson, has been released from psychiatric care and into isolation at Wentworth, where she is plotting her revenge.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Vera, Bridget and Bea are forced to collaborate when Ferguson launches a campaign to be released into the general prison population - a move that would place the former governor in considerable danger and reflect badly on the current one should anything go wrong. Meanwhile, Kaz stages a naked protest in the yard to try to force Vera to grant conjugal visits, but it ends in chaos as she and Will have a charged altercation.(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Youngster Dorothy Gale is whisked over the rainbow by a tornado into the magical land of Oz, where she inadvertently kills a wicked witch - incurring the wrath of another. Setting out to find the wizard who can show her a way home, she is joined on her journey by a scarecrow, a tin man and a cowardly lion, who all hope their own wishes will be granted. Musical fantasy, with Judy Garland, Ray Bolger, Jack Haley, Bert Lahr and Frank Morgan.(n)

Drama, directed by and starring Ben Affleck. With Rebecca Hall and Jeremy Renner.(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Mike Myers is back as the self-styled sexiest spy in the world in this achingly funny sequel. This time Austin goes back to the 60s to trap his nemesis, Dr Evil - but Evil's not the only adversary he must face this time. There's also Evil's scaled-down accomplice Mini-Me, not to mention the grotesque Fat Bastard. Heather Graham co-stars as Austin's squeeze this time around, although there's a blink-and-you'll-miss-it reappearance by Liz Hurley from the first movie and additional appearances from the likes of Robert Wagner and Rob Lowe(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster(n)

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: John Frankenheimer's thriller stars Ben Affleck as Rudy Duncan, an ex- prisoner who assumes a dead cell-mate's identity to hijack his romance with Ashley, who had been sending him love letters. But her brother Gabriel knows Nick used to work in a casino and wants the security details so he can stage a spectacular robbery. Now Rudy has to stay one step ahead of the game to stay alive..(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: Gruesome, controversial horror classic about the demonic possession of a young girl. A famous actress calls upon medical science for help when her daughter begins behaving strangely. But as bizarre and horrific incidents involving the daughter increase, the mother turns in desperation to the church - and to a priest who doubts his own faith(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: The final instalment in this hugely successful trilogy, takes place in Hollywood during production of "Stab 3, Return To Woodsboro". The production is a thriller which raises troubling questions about the events that terrified Woodsboro and continue to haunt Sidney Prescott. Three and a half years after leaving Windsor College, Sidney has settled in to a life of quiet seclusion in Northern Carolina. But that uneasy peace is shattered when terror erupts on the set of "Stab 3". Hotshot TV presenter Gale Weathers is called to the scene by the LAPD as the ultimate expert on the previous murders, and is reunited with Dewey. Will they survive to tell the tale this time?(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Robert Redford and Helen Mirren shine in this suspenseful thriller about a wealthy couple torn apart when the husband is kidnapped by a disgruntled former employee (Willem Dafoe). The millionaire's abduction sets off a nationwide FBI manhunt. Alessandro Nivola, Matt Craven, Melissa Sagemiller, Wendy Crewson(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. M,W,R(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Bob Hoskins star in Francis Ford Coppola's panorama of love, crime and entertainment in this stylish gangster film, centred on the legendary Harlem Nightclub. (1984)(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Gripping epic, set just prior to WWII, bursts at the seams with charismatic star turns by Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. She's a prim English aristocrat who returns to Australia to claim an inherited ranch, and he's a rugged drover who helps her battle wealthy land-grabbers trying to steal it from her. To make matters worse, the Japanese are threatening to invade the continent. Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, Essie Davis, Brandon Walters. Produced, cowritten and directed by Baz Luhrmann(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The parents of a baby given up for adoption could provide a clue to the death of a new mother - but the investigation also turns up long-buried family secrets. The detectives are forced to consider the possibility that racial prejudice played a part in the case.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy tries to trap a crooked lawyer who bribes his clients - but as he tries to track down the man's accomplice, he realises the investigation has placed his own job on the line. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.desc: The team runs a sting operation at a local car dealership to apprehend criminals with outstanding arrest warrants. However, it is not long before one of the targets smells a rat - prompting another of the marks to take flight. Drama, starring Missy Peregrym.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Cure for Loneliness.
programme.desc: When the body of 22-year-old Nina Dickerson is discovered on the floor in her apartment by two young peeping toms with a spy cam, Jake concludes that it was suicide when he finds an empty bottle of hemlock in her bin. However, as several details do not make sense, Laura is not convinced and badgers Captain Santiani into taking the case further. Starring Debra Messing and Josh Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate when a student is shot dead after a party gets out of control. The victim's boyfriend is arrested, but the officers later receive a tip-off about someone else - a vengeful youth deliberately infecting girls with HIV. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate an attack on a nurse, and discover she had been moving house regularly in an effort to evade a stalker who terrorised her with distressing e-mails. The victim regains consciousness, but fails to identify her attacker, leading to the shocking revelation that she may have fabricated the assault story as a way of attracting attention.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Delko is rushed to hospital with potentially fatal gunshot wounds, and Horatio waits anxiously as medics try to revive him, while the rest of the team searches for his assailant. Calleigh and Ryan process the crime scene, and question a security guard who provides them with what appears to be vital information - until further evidence sheds new light on the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee is sent to a women's prison to interview a murder suspect, but ends up being captured by the inmates, who have run riot and seized control of a cell block, afraid they will be blamed for killing a guard. Held hostage as a bargaining chip, he tries to identify the real culprit before the warden takes drastic action to resolve the crisis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is attacked by a knife-wielding woman who accuses him of war crimes, alleging he tortured and killed her brother in Afghanistan in the early 1980s. Gibbs investigates and ascertains what really happened - but has to work with the Afghan embassy to avoid an international incident. Drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.desc: Jaruszalski and Morales investigate when thieves known to be part of a crime ring turn their attention away from robbery and toward assault and murder. Crime drama, starring Corey Stoll and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.desc: Reports of sexual abuse surface at an elite private school, prompting Detective Benson and ADA Barba to confront a powerful administrator to expose decades of secrets. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man goes on a killing spree, leaving Benson and the team to detain a prostitute who is part of his social circle. Hard-hitting drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

Guest starring Michael K Williams (The Wire).(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick and Greg are puzzled when a famous comedian is found dead in his locked dressing room, with the cause of death identified as drowning. Meanwhile, Ray, Catherine and Sara investigate why a dangerous fugitive was discovered with more than 100 bullet holes in his body.(n)

However, Columbo sets out to uncover the truth. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Jack Cassidy.(n)

programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. programme.title: NCIS

Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.(n)

It's hardly a holly-jolly Christmas for Christopher (David Sutcliffe), now more convinced than ever that Lorelai (Lauren Graham) married him only to get over her relationship with Luke (Scott Patterson). Thus, when Emily (Kelly Bishop) plans to have the couple repeat their vows at a lavish party, chances are that neither Lorelai nor Christopher will even show up. Elsewhere, Luke begins legal action to claim partial custody of daughter April, then has a public confrontation with Christopher which does a neat job of shattering the town's Yuletide cheer (to say nothing of the Town Square decorations!) And Lucy (Krysten Ritter) finally finds out about the "history" between Rory (Alexis Bledel) and Marty (Wayne Wilcox). This episode was directed by series regular Jackson Douglas (Jackson Melville)(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. programme.title: Gnomeo & Juliet
programme.desc: The animated tale Gnomeo & Juliet knowingly follows the quintessential star-crossed lovers tragedy +Romeo and Juliet, with the unexpected twist of making the characters garden gnomes that can move when human beings aren't watching. Though Gnomeo (James McAvoy) and Juliet (Emily Blunt) belong to feuding garden-gnome families, they meet and fall in love. But the clans' shared animosity is exacerbated when Tybalt (Jason Statham) dies in part because of actions taken by Gnomeo to defend a friend whom Tybalt was attacking. After getting some sage advice from a statue of William Shakespeare (Patrick Stewart), Gnomeo attempts to set things right, and win the heart of the lawn ornament he loves. The supporting cast includes the vocal talents of Michael Caine, Hulk Hogan, and Maggie Smith(n)

programme.desc: Banker Andrew Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is in jail with a life sentence for the presumed murder of his wife and lover. He affirms to be innocent and will fight against time and the unfavorable conditions of one of the worst prisons of the country to keep alive his dream of being set free. In jail, he meets Red (Morgan Freeman), the ¿fixer¿, and they strike up a relation that goes further beyond the walls of the prison. Based on a short novel by Stephen King, The Shawshank of Redemption is a film about time and loyalty. The movie was highly acclaimed by the critic and public and received seven Oscar nominations. A story filled with emotion and hope(n)

programme.desc: This direct-to-DVD sequel features Rob Lowe as an Iraq War veteran whose past comes back to haunt him in Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming. Upon returning home from the line of duty, National Guard Captain Ted Cogan thought his life would go back to normal, until he started seeing visions of a group of innocent bystanders he inadvertently killed in Iraq. With his family on the brink of destruction, Ted turns to a psychic that aids him in understanding what needs to be done to put these restless souls at peace - even if it means giving up his own life(n)

Marisa Tomei co-stars as Rourke's on-again, off-again paramour, the single mother of a young son with whom Rourke strikes up a rapport(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family in this yuletide horror comedy based on ancient folklore(n)

programme.title: MacArthur

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell fights to prevent a resurrected Chinese emperor taking over the world(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: In 1974 scientists mixed extraterestrial DNA with human DNA to create a new species. The creature, now a young girl, escapes and mutates into a beuatiful young woman intent on seducing unknowing men(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Mild-mannered scientist Bruce Banner has been traveling the globe in search of the antidote that will allow him to break free from his primal alter ego, but both the warmongers who long to exploit him for their own gain and a horrific creature known as The Abomination are determined to stop him from achieving his noble goal in Transporter 2 director Louis Leterrier's take on the classic Marvel Comics superhero tale. For years, Bruce (Edward Norton) has been living in the shadows, pursued by the military and haunted by the rage within. But traveling the world in secrecy isn't easy, and as hard as he tries Bruce can't get Betty Ross (Liv Tyler) off his mind. The daughter of Bruce's nemesis Gen. Thaddeus "Thunderbolt" Ross (William Hurt), Betty represents everything that is beautiful in the world to a man who lives his life on the run. Eventually, Bruce returns to civilization and faces the wrath of The Abomination. While the Hulk may be a formidable force of nature, The Abomination is decidedly more powerful, and determined to destroy Bruce Banner. Created when KGB agent Emil Blonsky (Tim Roth) exposed himself to a higher dose of the same radiation that transformed Bruce into The Hulk, The Abomination is unable to change back into human form and holds Bruce accountable for his frightful condition. With time fast running out for both Bruce and The Hulk, New York City is about to become the ultimate urban battle zone as two of the most powerful creatures ever to walk the earth clash in a massive, no-holds-barred fight to the finish(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Antonio Banderas, Rodrigo Santoro, and Martin Sheen star in this ensemble drama detailing the daring real-life rescue of 33 Chilean miners who were trapped in the San Jose Mine for 69 days in 2010. Patricia Riggen directs from a script by Jose Rivera and Mikko Alanne(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: The Martian

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: Lightning War. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents and modern techniques of colouring and satellite mapping. Germany took just four weeks to conquer Poland, using a new form of warfare - Blitzkrieg. Six armoured tank units known as Panzer divisions, supported by the Luftwaffe, quickly broke through Polish defences and were so successful that Hitler also used them against the Allies. Despite superior men and equipment, France and England had not learned the lessons of the Polish defeat and were utterly at a loss how to counter such attacks. (Followed by News)(n)

programme.desc: Coverage of a meeting Down Under.(n)

programme.title: Racing News
programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.title: Racing Review
programme.desc: A look back at yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Sport on Saturday
programme.desc: Reports and previews.(n)

programme.title: Racing News
programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.title: Racing Review
programme.desc: A look back at yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Racing News
programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.title: Raceday Live
programme.desc: Coverage of today's meetings at Wolverhampton and Limerick.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright reports on a teeth-whitening businesses that ruined customers' teeth, fake headphones that could be harmful, and halogen heaters that put a woman's life in danger.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin visit more properties, featuring two in Wolverhampton and Greenford, west London, that need a lot of work, and one near Derby that the owners believe needs just minor improvements.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Sheriffs Lawrence and Kev plan to remove a valuable Bentley unless a debt is paid in full, and elsewhere the team are called to repossess a property occupied by squatters.(n)

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Officers of the Insurance Fraud Enforcement Department unravel the plot when an aspiring film director claims for lost camera equipment.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles takes up the reins as presenter in Peterborough, where experts Charles Hanson and Caroline Hawley help contestants find items at a bargain price to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: The Loneliness of the Long-Distance Swimmer.
programme.desc: Mrs Tembe discovers a man wearing only a towel in her kitchen, and Jimmi finds a hungover teenager in his hotel room. Meanwhile, Ayesha tries to get to the bottom of Karl's illness.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: North Yorkshire teacher Cornelius returns with confidence to continue his quest to crack a code that will open a safe full of money. Hosted by Matt Allwright. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple who are planning to wave goodbye to town living and are searching for a home in Dorset that meets their £450,000 budget. She also tries her hand at the popular equestrian sport of carriage driving.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths hidden gems at a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, including a classic table, a pair of chairs and a piece of retro outdoor furniture. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: In the great nave of Norwich Cathedral, experts Kate Bateman and David Fletcher pick out some chose items to take to auction. Among them are an enamel topped silver trinket box and a vintage model car. Plus, presenter Paul Martin uncovers the meaning of religious graffiti.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon hosts the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with England cricketer James Anderson, former heptathlon star Kelly Sotherton, ex-gymnast Beth Tweddle and footballer Matthew Upson joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Carters receive yet more bad news when they reach their overdraft limit, meaning they are unable to order stock for the Vic. Michelle and Sharon try to mend Bex and Louise's friendship, while Donna spends her first night in her new home playing drinking games with Abi, Ben and Jay. A nervous Lauren heads for her job interview, and on the way in she bumps into Josh, who offers her a few words of encouragement.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Broadcaster and restaurant critic Jay Rayner sets the brief for the fourth quarter-final, challenging the contenders to cook a savoury dish that showcases aubergine or a dessert with honey as the star. After preparing their dish, the candidates must stand before Jay and presenters John Torode and Gregg Wallace and hear what they think of their offering and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: New series. The topical news quiz, still featuring original team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton, returns for the first instalment of its 53rd series. Helping the duo poke fun at the week's events are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and Labour MP Angela Eagle MP, while stepping into the hot seat for this edition as guest host is accomplished thespian Patrick Stewart. Despite being a household name across the Western world through Star Trek and X-Men, the actor remains just as proud of his association with Huddersfield Town as the brace of hit sci-fi franchises.(n)

programme.title: Hospital People
programme.desc: New series. Comedy following the lives of Brimlington hospital's inept DJ Ivan Brackenbury, its ambitious manager Susan Mitchell, porter and spirit medium Ian D Montfort and over-enthusiastic chaplain Fr Kenny Mercer - all played by Tom Binns. In the opening episode, Susan learns she has won the bid for Brimlington to host the Annual Regional Hospital Awards and bagged a star host for the evening, a veteran of long-running fictional hospital drama Good Medicine. Fr Kenny and Ivan vie for the Patients Choice Awards, while Ian is forced to face conventional medicine head on. With Alex Macqueen.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: One Direction star Harry Styles chats about his life and career and gives an exclusive UK television performance of his debut solo single Sign of the Times, while Vicky McClure discusses the nail-biting police drama Line of Duty, in which she appears. Mrs Brown herself, Irish funnyman Brendan O'Carroll, also joins the host alongside comedian Rob Brydon, who talks about The Trip to Spain, his new series with Steve Coogan currently airing on Sky Atlantic.(n)

programme.title: Witless
programme.desc: The time arrives for Rhona and Leanne to find out the truth about Patrick's shady criminal connections - and Leanne has a bombshell of her own for her ex-lover.(n)

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hopes to win a mean-spirited contest held by his bosses to find the most ridiculous dinner-party guest for everyone to mock. He thinks he has found the perfect winning entry when he meets a dim-witted and socially awkward amateur taxidermist - but has to contend with pretending they are friends. Comedy, with Steve Carell and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Comedy star Jason Manford joins John Torode in the kitchen this morning, where he samples dishes prepared by chefs Rich Turner and Lisa Allen.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Absolute Favourites
programme.desc: The veteran cook focuses on recipes inspired by her love of the countryside. Mushrooms are one of Mary's favourite ingredients and she goes foraging for wild varieties in the New Forest, before cooking garlic mushrooms on toasted brioche and mushroom Scotch eggs - ideal for a country picnic hamper. To follow, Mary makes paprika pheasant with mushroom sauce. The Great British Bake Off judge also tries her hand at fly-fishing on the River Test, cooking up her catch on the riverbank. Later, she prepares apple cakes made from windfall fruit.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's matches, including the FA Cup semi-finals at Wembley Stadium and six fixtures in the Premier League.(n)

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.sub-title: London Marathon: My Reason to Run.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan looks ahead to tomorrow's race, profiling the main contenders for the elite races and providing an insight into some of the stories of those running for charity.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Eight.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents as the eighth day's play continues at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the concluding session of Liang Wenbo v Ding Junhui in round two and the start of Stephen Maguire v Rory McLeod. Ding came through three qualifying rounds last year to reach the Crucible, but his efforts were rewarded by a run to his first world final, and his match against Judd Trump was one of the highlights of round two.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 5.15pm). Coverage of the opening semi-final from Wembley Stadium, as the London rivals battle it out. The Blues have a highly impressive recent record in this competition, having lifted the trophy five times in the last 10 years, while Spurs have not reached the final since they won the competition in 1991. However, Mauricio Pochettino's men will draw some confidence from their 2-0 win when the sides met at White Hart Lane in the Premier League three months ago.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor and Bill find themselves in a gleaming, perfect city in the far future, at the edge of the galaxy. This new settlement is said to hold the secret of human happiness, but when the pair try to make contact with the locals, all they find are piles of grinning skulls. As the Time Lord and his new travelling pal seek to solve the terrifying mystery, a sinister force stirs within the walls, and from the shadows the cute but deadly emojibots are watching. Guest starring Ralf Little, with Matt Lucas as Nardole.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. The first day of Cal's planned strike arrives, and while he and his allies set up their picket line, Lily struggles to decide where her loyalties lie. Inside the hospital, the industrial action causes trouble for Sam, who resolves to make up for staff shortages by manning the ED himself, despite his lack of experience. Meanwhile, Iain's pride over Gemma's recent achievements is dashed when he realises she was the one who leaked lurid pictures of Alicia online, and a hard-line racist is admitted after being injured in a pub brawl.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes and the family are joined in studio by choirmaster Gareth Malone and singer Peter Andre, while Steps perform their new single Scared of the Dark in Foley's pub and Nick Knowles teams up with Dermot and Buster for their Celebrity Boat Tour adventure.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including West Ham United v Everton at the Olympic Stadium and Bournemouth v Middlesbrough at the Vitality Stadium. The Hammers were looking to avoid being drawn further into the battle to avoid relegation, while Boro were aiming to move a step closer to an unlikely survival.(n)

programme.title: Murder in Successville
programme.desc: New series. Sleet and sidekick Richard Osman wade into the art underworld to catch Bjork's killer, with Hillary Clinton, Arsene Wenger, Zayn Malik and Bill Nighy all in the frame.(n)

programme.title: Reign of Fire
programme.desc: In the aftermath of decades of apocalyptic attacks by dragons, small pockets of survivors try to stave off the scaly fire-breathers. However, the meagre remains of the world's heavy artillery are not enough to stop them, so a small group of people joins forces with a zealous dragon slayer in a final bid to save the world from destruction. Fantasy adventure, with Christian Bale and Matthew McConaughey.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: Paramedics and coastguard come to the aid of an injured fisherman on the Isle of Man, a Windermere lake warden tends to a swan, and County Durham police deal with a car crash.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Presenter Paul Martin and the team discuss all things nautical as they offer advice on maritime collectibles. Caroline Hawley visits Hull to meet a man who gives a modern twist to the art of scrimshaw and Will Axon reveals a fish-related oddity from his personal collection.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Wetherby racecourse, West Yorkshire, antiques experts Charles Hanson and Kate Bliss help two teams find items likely to make the highest profit at auction. Presenter Anita Manning observes their progress and also pays a visit to the place where the modern railway began.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Monmouth.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles, his team and a group of volunteers are in Monmouth, Wales, to transform the family home of Charlotte, a mother recovering from a stroke that left her with brain damage, speech loss and partial paralysis. The current layout of her home makes it difficult for Charlotte to move around and have her physiotherapy treatment, so the team redesign the house to make things easier for her, her husband Rob and their children.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Seven.
programme.desc: Day seven gets under way at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second session of Stuart Bingham v Kyren Wilson and the start of Liang Wenbo v Ding Junhui.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Seven.
programme.desc: Further coverage of day seven at the Crucible Theatre, as round two continues in the final ranking tournament of the season, with Shaun Murphy v Ronnie O'Sullivan and Mark Allen v John Higgins. Three unseeded players made it through to the quarter-finals last year, with Ding Junhui, Kyren Wilson and Alan McManus beating Judd Trump, Allen and Ali Carter respectively to claim second-round victories. Presented by Hazel Irvine.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Panellists John Sergeant, Liz Carr and June Sarpong use their knowledge and debating skills to help contestant John from Surrey win a top cash prize. Hosted by Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, offering advice on plants that thrive on shady walls. He also sows rootcrops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden. Joe Swift pays a visit to a small town garden to learn how an interior designer has transformed her outdoor space. The programme also meets Charles Dowding who, since the 1980s, has pioneered the policy of `no dig' organic gardening. Plus, Flo Headlam showcases her Golden Jubilee plant. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.sub-title: Springwatch in Japan: Cherry Blossom Time.
programme.desc: The sakura spring is an impressive sight, as blankets of cherry blossom flowers transform Japan's landscape. Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and James Wong join hundreds of thousands of travellers visiting Japan to indulge in hanami - the national tradition of flower watching. As each follows their own sakura stories, the trio learn that the arrival of the blossom is not just a spectacle of nature - it has become one of the country's most important cultural moments, influencing its economy, tourism and family tradition.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: New series. A high-profile poisoning leaves a coveted vacancy, while pregnant Madame de Montespan exercises her influence at every opportunity. Is someone out to eclipse the Sun King? Louis' brother, the widower Philippe, cannot be allowed to remain single, though his exiled lover Chevalier has been allowed home - so a new marriage must be arranged. Meanwhile, the King recruits a writer to chronicle the glories of his reign. George Blagden stars in this period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of Louis XIV.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Extended edition of the music programme. Ed Sheeran performs in three different set-ups, including debuting the Irish band that accompanies him on his hit tune Galway Girl, while cult guitar legend Michael Chapman is on the show for the first time, as he celebrates 50 years of touring. Plus, music by Valerie June, Syd, Dayme Arocena and Marian Hill.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: The concluding session on day seven at the Crucible Theatre, where the match between Stuart Bingham and Kyren Wilson was scheduled to end, and Liang Wenbo v Ding Junhui continued.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents extended highlights of matches from the second round on the seventh day of the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world, beginning with Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, which employs 9,500 people and caters for a million guests a year. Their duties include acting as attendants at the world's largest infinity pool, working as a butler under a former special forces officer, and joining a catering team that provides Brazilian, Chinese, French and Japanese cuisine for 60 restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: New series. Peter Capaldi's eccentric, era-hopping Time Lord returns for his final series. However, before he hands over the key to the Tardis to his as-yet-undecided successor, there's the matter of the girl with a star in her eye to deal with. A chance encounter brings Bill Potts into contact with the Doctor, who is conducting a secret mission on Earth. What follows is a terrifying chase across time and space, one that opens Bill's mind to the prospect of a bigger and wider universe than she'd ever imagined. Pearl Mackie makes her debut Doctor Who appearance as new companion Bill, while Matt Lucas also stars as the Doctor's old ally Nardole.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Tom Thumb
programme.desc: A fairy queen grants a couple's wish to have children, in the shape of a miniature boy who possesses unusual magical talents. The tiny youth foils the schemes of a pair of crooks and helps a kindly musician find true love. Children's musical fantasy based on the Brothers Grimm's fairytale, starring Russ Tamblyn, Terry-Thomas and Peter Sellers.(n)

programme.title: That's Entertainment
programme.desc: Compilation of moments from some of the great MGM musicals, such as The Wizard of Oz, Singin' in the Rain, and Meet Me in St Louis. Featuring performances from Frank Sinatra, Fred Astaire, Bing Crosby, Gene Kelly, Peter Lawford, Judy Garland, Clark Gable, Ann Miller and Liza Minnelli.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Eight.
programme.desc: Second-round coverage from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Shaun Murphy v Ronnie O'Sullivan and the second session of Mark Allen v John Higgins.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives a masterclass in roasting, beginning with a French twist to the traditional British dish of roast beef and Yorkshire pudding. He also uses the technique to cook a piece of turbot on a bed of fennel, and trims a pineapple before roasting it whole for dessert.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes to sate cravings for a takeaway, including fish and chips from James Martin and a pizza recipe from Keith Floyd.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, offering advice on plants that thrive on shady walls. He also sows rootcrops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden. Joe Swift pays a visit to a small town garden to learn how an interior designer has transformed her outdoor space. The programme also meets Charles Dowding who, since the 1980s, has pioneered the policy of `no dig' organic gardening. Plus, Flo Headlam showcases her Golden Jubilee plant. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.sub-title: Live European Gymnastics Championships: Apparatus Finals: 2017.
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents coverage of the seventh staging of the event, which this year takes place at Competition Hall in Cluj, Romania. Great Britain's Becky Downie will be aiming to retain the title she won in 2016 on the uneven bars, and her sister Ellie will be looking to improve on her silver medal won 12 months ago on the vault. Also taking place are the men's floor, pommel horse and rings events.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: A round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin is joined by Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley for a visit to Haddon Hall in Derbyshire, where a large silver bowl and an early tin-plate toy catch the experts' eyes. Plus, the presenter learns about how beer would have been brewed in medieval times.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at the Royal Mansour in Marrakesh, Morocco, which was built by royal decree to showcase the region to world leaders, as well as billionaires and celebrity guests. Monica works with executive housekeeper Laurence, who shows her each of the 350 pairs of curtains must be caressed by hand to create perfect pleats, while Giles dons the uniform of the hotel butlers as he is introduced him to the hotel's underground tunnels, which ensure absolute discretion to the guests.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Eight.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the final session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the second-round match between Mark Allen and John Higgins is due to finish and Mark Selby v Xiao Guodong set to begin. Selby won the title for the second time in his career here last year, but the Jester from Leicester received an almighty scare in round two against Sam Baird, before edging through 13-11.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Ore Oduba are joined by celebrated ballerina Darcey Bussell as they host coverage of the grand final of this year's Young Dancer of the Year contest. Over the course of the past months, entrants for the Street Dance, Ballet, South Asian and Contemporary categories have been whittled down to five finalists, with one act representing each discipline, along with a `wildcard' entrant. Now, Royal Ballet director Kevin O'Hare, choreographers Jasmine Vardimon, Marc Brew, Kate Prince and Kenneth Tharp, and Kathak dancer Nahid Siddiqui must decide which entrant will claim the title. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel show, in which correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, in favour of answers the host finds most interesting. This time, Sandi Toksvig, Aisling Bea, Susan Calman and regular panellist Alan Davies navigate the topic of mathematics.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: New series. A high-profile poisoning leaves a coveted vacancy, while pregnant Madame de Montespan exercises her influence at every opportunity. Is someone out to eclipse the Sun King? Louis' brother, the widower Philippe, cannot be allowed to remain single, though his exiled lover Chevalier has been allowed home - so a new marriage must be arranged. Meanwhile, the King recruits a writer to chronicle the glories of his reign. George Blagden stars in this period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of Louis XIV.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Highlights of the concluding session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where Mark Allen v John Higgins was set to come to a finish. Presented by Hazel Irvine.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Mike Read introduce performances by David Bowie, Howard Jones and Hot Chocolate. First shown on September 22 1983.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: Leonard Sachs chairs the old-time music hall programme, inviting Roy Castle, Barbara Windsor, Robert Tear, Benjamin Luxon, Ted Durante and Hilda, and performers from the Players Theatre, London, to entertain an audience at the Leeds City Varieties. First shown on March 7 1978.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Compilation of archive performances, comprising Patti LaBelle's Lady Marmalade, Chic's Le Freak and Love Don't Live Here Any More by Rose Royce.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Funk: One Nation Under a Groove
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history of funk, starting from its birth in the black community at a time of self-discovery, struggle and social change. The fun style of the music changed the streets of the US in the seventies with new trends in fashion and slang emerging, and its celebration of African-American culture. The genre produced some of the most famous acts in the world, such as James Brown, Sly & the Family Stone, Earth, Wind & Fire, and Kool & the Gang. Including interviews with George Clinton, Ray Parker Jr and trombonist Fred Wesley.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of Funk
programme.desc: A compilation of performances from the BBC archive, beginning in the 1970s with acts including Earth, Wind & Fire, Kool & the Gang, Average White Band and Herbie Hancock.(n)

programme.title: Music for Misfits: The Story of Indie
programme.desc: During the 1980s, independent record labels transformed from cottage industries into real businesses that could compete with the majors. This documentary recalls the first cross-over of alternative music into the mainstream chart, as well as the emergence of fanzines, whereby aspiring music journalists could access their favourite indie stars at the small and intimate gigs where they performed. Narrator Mark Radcliffe also considers the latter part of the decade when the emerging acid house rave culture spawned a new crop of bands such as the Stone Roses and Happy Mondays. Contributors include Stephen Morris, Gillian Gilbert, James Dean Bradfield and Shaun Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Mike Read introduce performances by David Bowie, Howard Jones and Hot Chocolate. First shown on September 22 1983.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Funk: One Nation Under a Groove
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history of funk, starting from its birth in the black community at a time of self-discovery, struggle and social change. The fun style of the music changed the streets of the US in the seventies with new trends in fashion and slang emerging, and its celebration of African-American culture. The genre produced some of the most famous acts in the world, such as James Brown, Sly & the Family Stone, Earth, Wind & Fire, and Kool & the Gang. Including interviews with George Clinton, Ray Parker Jr and trombonist Fred Wesley.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of Funk
programme.desc: A compilation of performances from the BBC archive, beginning in the 1970s with acts including Earth, Wind & Fire, Kool & the Gang, Average White Band and Herbie Hancock.(n)

programme.title: Music for Misfits: The Story of Indie
programme.desc: During the 1980s, independent record labels transformed from cottage industries into real businesses that could compete with the majors. This documentary recalls the first cross-over of alternative music into the mainstream chart, as well as the emergence of fanzines, whereby aspiring music journalists could access their favourite indie stars at the small and intimate gigs where they performed. Narrator Mark Radcliffe also considers the latter part of the decade when the emerging acid house rave culture spawned a new crop of bands such as the Stone Roses and Happy Mondays. Contributors include Stephen Morris, Gillian Gilbert, James Dean Bradfield and Shaun Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Dan Cruickshank: At Home with the British
programme.desc: The historian celebrates British homes, starting with a visit to the picturesque Warwickshire countryside and the village of Stoneleigh, which has barely changed in 500 years, its cottages perfectly preserved. Here he charts the cottage's transformation from humble hovel to modern dream home.(n)

programme.title: Tankies: Tank Heroes of World War II
programme.sub-title: The Men and the Machines That Beat Hitler.
programme.desc: The two-part documentary telling the stories of six men who served in the Royal Tank Regiment concludes, with the men taking part in the D-Day landings, the battle for Normandy and the eventual victory in Germany.(n)

programme.title: Department Q: A Conspiracy of Faith
programme.desc: Premiere. Copenhagen cold-case cop Carl Morck and his assistant Assad find themselves pursuing another mystery when an eight-year-old message in a bottle finds its way to their department. Pursuing this new line of inquiry draws them into a horrific case involving a psychopathic murderer, religious fanaticism and abducted siblings who were, for some unknown reason, never reported missing by their parents. Danish crime thriller, starring Nikolaj Lie Kaas, based on Jussi Adler-Olsen's Department Q novels.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
