programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Jack decides on a career as a massage therapist and asks a reluctant Karen to let him practise on her back, while Grace is offered the chance to buy her studio space and convinces Will to help negotiate a fair price - but ends up shocked by his hard-nosed tactics. Starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray becomes envious of Robert's good looks and decides the time has come to get a head-to-toe makeover, complete with fake tan. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra learns the second-hand car she bought from Marie and Frank was once the scene of an amorous encounter for a teenage Ray - and promptly decides she does not want it any more. Patricia Heaton and Ray Romano star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray discovers the stone in Debra's engagement ring is a fake, and decides to get it changed without telling her - only to learn afterwards that she had beaten him to the punch and had her grandmother's $15,000 diamond put in. Meanwhile, Robert decides to surprise his new girlfriend with a change of hair colour.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink worries he is being stalked by an unbalanced fan after receiving strange gifts with seemingly threatening messages attached. In an effort to thwart any assassination attempt he hires a female bodyguard to protect him at an awards ceremony. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Worried that Martin has never expressed his love for them, Frasier and Niles join their father on a fishing trip in the hope that they can bond with him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of Lela's, a California restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Seven strangers are locked in a jury room and must answer general knowledge questions unanimously to accumulate as much money as possible. Pressure mounts as one juror's adamant approach causes a stand-off.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan tries to get to grips with a room-sized antique music player, and also looks at a guitar signed by pop star Noel Gallagher. At Pickwick in south-east London, Nathan and right-hand woman Debs consider doing deals on some charm bracelets full of precious memories, and a luxury lighter originally bought for a jaw-dropping 4,000 euros.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with farmer and Countryfile presenter Adam Henson alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig welcomes back the 15 best winners from the series to compete in the Grand Final, battling to pocket the £40,000 prize on offer.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Chris and Sherrine Kingsley-Smith have spent most of their 14-year marriage travelling the world on a boat but are now ready to drop anchor for dry land. Chris is keen on the rural lifestyle on offer in the Cotswolds where they already have friends, but Sherrine has her heart set on the Dordogne region of France where they're currently renting. Jonnie Irwin tries to keep them in the UK with a budget of £700,000, while Jasmine Harman tempts them with some amazing properties in France for up to £900,000.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Competitive couple Mike and Lisa kick off the contest in Worcester with an Italian-themed menu inspired by their upcoming wedding in Sorrento. Day two sees Linda and Steve cook up a completely home-made, tried-and-tested menu, although Lisa is looking to find fault with the food. With expectations high, married couple Paul and Paul need to improve on a solid effort from the earlier hosts, but will risk lead them to reward or disaster?.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A dejected Mr Burns tries to improve his public image by taking part in a series of lowbrow radio talk shows and bringing the legendary Loch Ness monster to Springfield. With the voice of Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Nick is horrified by the surprise party that Holly throws for him, and Louis interrupts one of the classes to do a bag search. Elsewhere, Neeta turns to Hunter for help after discovering that her tablet has gone missing.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Seyi Rhodes reports from the set of a hit South Korean TV show that has made defectors from North Korea into TV stars. Now on My Way to Meet You mixes showbiz entertainment and shocking personal testimony, with local celebrities quizzing the defectors on what life is like across the border. More than 400 defectors have been interviewed and their stories chart the very latest about life under Kim Jong-un, which for many South Koreans has become a major source of information about their northern neighbour.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: New series. The return of the programme offering an insight into the world of high-end pawnbroking. James takes a ride around London in an eye-catching supercar, with an aspiring fitness guru who's looking for £80,000. With her eyes on a round-the-world cruise costing £30,000, an adventurous retiree wants to sell a collection of handbags and jewellery. A car enthusiast contacts memorabilia expert Lawrence about a helmet that once belonged to land speed record-breaker Donald Campbell, and James faces a dilemma when he gets an offer for one of his favourite impulse buys.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including Britain's Got Talent, Nature's Weirdest Event, Doctor Who, First Dates, Culinary Genius and the News.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by guests Alan Carr and Tinie Tempah for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The hosts make use of the £isitok twitter handle, where viewers tweet in edgy current affairs questions that more fearful shows might duck.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: New series. Dapper 24-year-old Will is looking for a woman to share his love of the countryside, but he has never had a girlfriend and is not a natural when it comes to chatting up a lady, while lofty long-haired rocker Daniel, aka Squid, strides into the restaurant on a mission to break the rules. Mum-of-two Emma, 47, is all glammed up and ready to play the love lottery, but Cupid throws a huge surprise her way, and when the man who broke her heart walks through the door the drama begins.(n)

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind posing as a professor rents a room in the Deep South from an elderly woman in a bid to tunnel through her basement to a nearby casino. However, the unsuspecting landlady unintentionally gets in the way of his plans. The Coen brothers' remake of the Ealing comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Irma P Hall and Marlon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: The Ballroom Boys
programme.desc: In the world of competitive ballroom there's a serious shortage of young male dancers, with hundreds of girls lining up for every boy. This film follows four south Wales lads as they head towards the biggest competition of their dancing lives - the UK Championships in Bournemouth.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Robbie Coltrane stars as Paul Finchley, one half of a much-loved comedy double act, whose life is turned upside down when he is arrested after an accusation of rape that dates back to the 1990s. Paul adamantly denies having even met the woman making the allegation and his loyal wife (Julie Walters) must decide whether to stand by him, while his troubled daughter (Andrea Riseborough) begins to question her relationship with her father.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Part-time wrestler and van driver Phil wins the bid to transport six boxes of live crayfish, while Shahbaz's load is two grand pianos worth thousands.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton helps Alan and Lucy Brown to build an upside-down house in Fife with stunning views of the Forth Bridge, but the budget struggles to keep pace with the build.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie takes a close look at upcycling in Bath as she helps more people transform their homes.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1 The Grid
programme.desc: Including action from the opening round of the Blancpain GT Series, round one of the World Endurance Championship, and the IndyCar Series' Toyota Grand Prix of Long Beach.(n)

programme.title: British GT Championship
programme.sub-title: Motor Sport: British GT: 2017 Oulton Park.
programme.desc: Action from Oulton Park, where the opening races of the season took place.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug coaches a kids' football team, but is persuaded by Deacon's son to take up the sport himself. Though Carrie is impressed with his new determination to get into shape, he soon realises how unfit he has become once he takes to the field.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Barones' cable TV goes on the blink, leaving them with a large amount of time on their hands - which they fill by playing games. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's accusation that Ray is pessimistic stirs him into adopting a more positive outlook, but the rest of the family is not impressed by his change in attitude. Figure skater Katarina Witt guests stars in the comedy, with Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A caller to his radio show gives Frasier the impression Niles's wife Maris might be having an affair with her fencing instructor. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Bebe advises Frasier to feign illness to secure a pay rise and prove he is indispensable, but the station responds by cleaning out his cubicle and auditioning for a replacement. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Harriet Sansom Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon upsets guest star Stephen Hawking when they play an online game of Words with Friends, until Howard advises him to let the scientist win. Elsewhere, Penny enrols in a college class, but decides to keep it a secret from Leonard. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mother's house.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a union representative at the power plant and immediately uses his new-found authority to save the company's free dental plan and avoid having to pay for Lisa's new braces. Featuring the voice of Dr Joyce Brothers.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tires of being followed everywhere by a lovestruck Ralph and hurts his feelings by blurting out in public that she cannot stand him - prompting disgruntled local lawman Chief Wiggum to harass Homer in retaliation.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa schemes to get her own back on Bart for destroying the prize tomato she grew for a science project. Meanwhile, Homer is arrested for drink-driving and finds himself having to attend Alcoholics Anonymous meetings.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Food
programme.desc: Kiran Jethwa ventures into the isolated Amazonian rainforest of Peru with the Huachipaeri and Matsiguenka tribes, where he samples termites. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Company director Sue hosts the first evening in the West Midlands, hoping to impress business guru Marc, teaching assistant Kim, manager Paul and mole catcher Michael.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the West Midlands, business guru Marc intends to use his coaching skills to plan an impressive night, but after annoying his fellow diners, he has a tough job ahead.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teaching assistant Kim hopes to win over her guests with a summer holiday-themed evening, as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the West Midlands.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: College manager and part-time comedian Paul is the fourth to play host in the West Midlands, turning his home into a pub in the hope of pulling in the points by pulling a few pints.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the last night in the West Midlands, and mole-catcher Michael intends to impress his guests with his night of fancy French cuisine, including a controversial main course.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Francophiles Madeline and Andy Morton from Portsmouth are looking for a holiday home they can fly or drive to in the rural landscapes of the Charente region in west-central France. With cash savings of £45,000, they're hoping for a traditional two-bedroom home with charm and character. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, hoping that one will be their dream house.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Cardiff to help another two couples find their dream home. Jo and Steve are relocating from Bristol to cut down on her commute to work, and Kirstie is on hand to provide them with advice on suitable properties for their needs. Phil accompanies Shauna and Todd, who admit their pricey taste in property is making it tough to find a family home.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Product designer Rebecca Sturrock has returned to her family home in Cornwall with her partner Gregory Kewish and a highly ambitious plan. Together they hope to transform a small, damp bungalow into a cutting-edge home to share with their twin three-year-old daughters - all for just £80,000. The design is radical - to reinforce the walls of the old property and add a new living space on top to take advantage of the views. This extra floor will be made entirely of thick wooden panels engineered in Germany and normally assembled by a crew of specialist installers. However, budget constraints mean the couple are determined to do it all themselves.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Making Western Flag
programme.desc: A short film telling the story of virtual reality artist John Gerrard's latest work, which takes the form of a digitally simulated version of the `Lucas Gusher', the first major find of the Texas Oil Boom of the early 20th century. The well, which is located in Beaumont, Texas, is simulated in real-time, with the sun rising and setting to match the time of day in Texas, and the exhibition centres on the image of a flagpole bearing a banner of perpetually renewing black smoke.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Fresh from the success of hosting a three-day wedding at the chateau, Dick and Angel make business plans for the grounds, intending to charge people to fish in the moat and forage in the woods. Angel starts work on a second guest suite, but also wants to install an elevator, which pushes Dick's engineering skills to the limit.(n)

programme.title: Man Made Planet: Earth from Space
programme.desc: Documentary, making use of Nasa's archive of images of Earth to detail the remarkable impact humanity has had on the planet's geography over the past 45 years. Astronauts including Tim Peake trawl through a treasure trove of whole-planet shots, beginning with the iconic 1972 image `Blue Marble', which marked the first-ever time a photograph was taken of the entire Earth. What they construct is a time-lapse snapshot of the planet, detailing everything from the evolution of China's megacities to the construction of giant solar arrays of Nevada, and their work reveals the extent to which human civilisation has transformed the planet - for better or worse.(n)

programme.title: Dracula Untold
programme.desc: Premiere. A Romanian knight fights to defend his homeland against Turkish invaders. Faced with overwhelming odds, he enters into a dangerous bargain to gain supernatural powers so he can drive off his enemies - but the deal could cost him his humanity as he transforms into a terrifying monster. Fantasy adventure, starring Luke Evans, Dominic Cooper and Charles Dance.(n)

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his father's honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrian's Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily finds a pirate's scarf on the beach, which prompts her to search for treasure on Driftwood Bay with Puffin.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: Mogu unintentionally eats all of Lee and Sioux's nuts, so Lee gets together all the forest dwellers for a meeting to establish some rules.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George want to be famous detectives, so Daddy Pig gives them a mystery to solve.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Kiss Great Aunty.
programme.desc: Great Aunty comes to visit, but the Little Princess does not want to kiss her because she has a scratchy chin.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The pups compete in a race across town to see which of them is the fastest, but Alex surprises them by entering on his super trike.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team take moving house to a whole new level when they literally have to move a house.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Steele's old fire engine Bessie is used in an emergency at the mountain activity centre - where gas canisters are in danger of exploding.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: James hears Duck talking about the slip coaches they used on the Great Western Railway, which could be uncoupled at stations without stopping, and presents it to the Fat Controller as his idea - but he soon runs into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The puppet goes to the seaside, where he tries to catch fish from a pier.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zeta puts a spell on Shimmer's mirror in order to steal her magic gems. However, in addition to the jewellery she accidentally transports Tala into her lair.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of Bling's Hidden Present.
programme.desc: Bling is so excited about her birthday that she starts opening all her presents ahead of schedule. Big Ear's hides his gift to stop her, but ends up forgetting where he put it.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Marshall's new pet Smiley is practising for a jumping competition, but the naughty frog hops into Skye's helicopter and activates the controls.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly goes on a camping trip with Ben and his parents, but the annoying Mr Gnome turns up.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Chips always wins the Great Nut Hunt - but when Grizel finds the map showing where all the hidden nuts are, she joins in the game too.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Zebra delivers a parcel from Aunt Dottie, causing Peppa and George to get excited.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Hamster's pet tortoise Tiddles becomes stuck up a tree and needs rescuing.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The little girl meets a clumsy elephant called Ellington who wants to be an acrobat.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The duo go gardening with Wanda's mother, and find a worm called Jim.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Jim O'Donnell offers dietary advice to the mother of a child with an ear, nose and throat infection, and Dr Manj Tawana treats an unwell patient whose blood test results show he may have leukaemia, which runs in his family. Dr Nithy Nanda is concerned about a blind patient who has a family history of heart disease when a monitor he has been wearing reveals irregularities.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary meets claimants living on the breadline in Yorkshire. They include 45-year-old Alex, who dreams of making it as a DJ and has just blown thousands of pounds on record decks, and Geordie couple Michelle and Thomas, who are now living in Leeds, where they are pushing for their children to have a better future. Plus, a Whitby man who says the sickness benefit he receives is only enough to feed his partner and baby daughter five days out of every seven.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Matt's plans are thrown into chaos when Ellie makes it clear she has no intention of going to Vietnam, while Ash gets a message there is no official record of his brother's death.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya feels hurt that Toadie still mistrusts her to be around Nell, Jimmy is unhappy with how Leo and Amy are treating each other, while Steph sees a new residential opportunity.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Revenge
programme.desc: A woman starts a relationship with a seemingly perfect man who has an intense relationship with his mother. She discovers his only previous girlfriend died mysteriously, and becomes consumed with paranoia as she investigates what became of her. Thriller, starring Alicia Ziegler, Mark Hapka and Donna Mills. Edited for violence.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya feels hurt that Toadie still mistrusts her to be around Nell, Jimmy is unhappy with how Leo and Amy are treating each other, while Steph sees a new residential opportunity.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Matt's plans are thrown into chaos when Ellie makes it clear she has no intention of going to Vietnam, while Ash gets a message there is no official record of his brother's death.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Georgie Barrat plays a new version of the popular Minecraft game while aiming to set a Guinness World Record by staying immersed in virtual reality for more than 25 hours. Ortis Deley helps two paramedics get the most out of their 30-minute breaks with gadgets designed to make healthy food and drinks in the shortest time possible, and he and Jon Bentley pit two new versions of market leading cameras up against each other. Plus, the latest money-saving tip in Wallop of the Week. Presented by Craig Charles.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, the presenter discovers how the longest stretch of steam railway would have disappeared, but for a team of volunteers dedicated to keeping the line and locomotives going. He also gets a rare glimpse inside the radar base at RAF Fylingdales, a missile-tracking facility that plays a significant role in the defence of both the UK and the USA. In Whitby, Tony visits the area's last shipyard and is delighted to hear that whales have returned to local waters after hunting almost drove them to extinction. His final destination is the picturesque coastal village of Robin Hood's Bay. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Spain with Alex Polizzi
programme.desc: The hotelier and presenter stays at the feted Marbella Beach Club, where she meets the man who has played host to A-list jetsetters for decades and has many interesting tales to tell. Moving on to the wild frontier terrain of Western Andalucia, an area often overlooked by tourists, Alex arrives in the quintessentially Spanish town of Jerez, the home of sherry, and learns how this rich drink is produced while admiring the amazing dancing steps of the local horses. Finally, she arrives in the vibrant city of Seville, capital of Andalucia, which she explores on bicycle.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Cruise Ship
programme.desc: Part two of two. After 18 months of construction, the Seven Seas Explorer's designers rush to choose the luxury fittings and fixtures, while almost 1,500 workers install everything from windows and flooring to the GPS navigation system. With just days until the first passengers are due on board, Captain Stanislas Mercier de Lacombe takes command and sets course for Monte Carlo. Here, the ship's godmother, Princess Charlene of Monaco, christens the vessel with a Goliath bottle containing seven gallons of champagne.(n)

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer embarks on a series of ocean odysseys, and while she is no stranger to the open sea, having found fame on 1998 BBC TV documentary The Cruise, the mega-cruiser she boards is a far cry from the 600-passenger vessel she is used to. In the opening edition, she and her fellow passengers stop off in Nassau in the Bahamas, where Jane finds solace in the state's oldest baptist church, and St Martin, where she seeks an intimate underwater audience with a host of sharks. Back on board, Jane is startled by the scale of everything - from the food and activities to the sheer number of people.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: Hi-tech crooks storm New Alcatraz jail, intent on freeing a death-row inmate who knows the whereabouts of $200million in gold bullion, but have reckoned without the intervention of a hardened FBI agent, who is working undercover as a prisoner to infiltrate gangster operations. Action adventure, starring Steven Seagal, Morris Chestnut, Ja Rule and Nia Peeples.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation edition reliving house-transforming triumphs from the series. Property expert Ann Maurice visits Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire, to demonstrate design techniques for making small rooms appear bigger, while in Glasgow she reveals how to create a home that appeals to potential purchasers. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow charts the life of Greek artist Domenicos Theotocopolous, dubbed El Greco, one of the most distinctive painters of the 16th century. His work was considered to be ahead of its time - so much so that it was all but ignored for 300 years. El Greco developed a highly individualistic style that eventually proved enormously influential, paving the way for the Baroque and providing the inspiration for 20th-century expressionism.(n)

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker highlights the plight of South American Orinoco crocodiles as he documents a conservation project in Venezuela to save the species from extinction. In addition to heading out on a dangerous night-time hunt to find out how the creatures are surviving in the wild, he tries to coax a three-year-old to return to the open river.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: The Stunt Gull display team is due to perform in Salty Cove when Cyril gets injured in training - meaning plans for the show are put on hold.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet meets a friend who shows him just how useful the wind can be.(n)

programme.desc: Kemi Majeks and Olivia Birchenough sample life as pirates in an electro-pop shanty bop.(n)

programme.desc: Little Miss Calamity is blown away by her ceiling fan, and Mr Pernickety's trip to the beach ends in a blazing row.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa plant seeds in Grandpa Pig's garden.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George eats his breakfast too quickly and gets hiccups.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The little girl and baby penguin Peggy persuade a bear that swimming in icy water can be fun.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The pups come to the rescue when Jake gets trapped under falling rocks while exploring a cave - but Rubble must conquer his fear of spiders to save his friend.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: A surprise birthday is set up for Wendy, but getting her there proves harder than expected.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Derek are inspired by their snowboarding hero Billy Bob Blizzard and decide to build a slalom-style obstacle course.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Two firefighters call in sick, so Royston the Firetruck enlists both Olly and Stan to help with any emergencies.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Albert the Amazing Magician fails to turn up in time to entertain the guests at Charlie's birthday party, so Stan and Olly decide to fill in with a few illusions of their own.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The pups must save the day when Alex puts too many balloons on Katie's float at the Adventure Bay Day celebration and parade, causing it to literally float away.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: The gang visits Velocity Ville, where snooty resident Speedrick locks everyone else up, leaving it up to Blaze to transform into a super-fast racer and save the day.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Big Brick Wall.
programme.desc: The toys want to play with Fuse's new electronic ball, but he's vanished and there's a big brick wall in front of his workshop.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The youngster asks Peggy to help after Monty complains that his meerkat colony is overcrowded.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves to dinner at the castle, where they sample Nanny Plum's cooking.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah and Zac try building a treehouse but find themselves in over their heads. Leah asks her genies for a treehouse, but her house becomes a house of trees.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster tries to stay awake to enjoy a midnight feast.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa teases George for having a baby's tricycle, but then the other children point out that Peppa's own bike is not all that grown-up either.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig makes a special box for Peppa to keep secret things in.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family fly a kite in the park.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum conjures up a hamster for the twins, but the naughty new pet causes chaos in the castle.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The Fugitoid reveals his terrible secret as Ulixes returns to Earth to stop Mozar from destroying the world. David Tennant guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: PC Barry Peach hunts for a man wanted for assault, officers are hot on the heels of a suspected drug dealer, a drunken driver tries every trick in the book to avoid giving a breath sample and dog-handler Jon Peacock has a late-night encounter with two unusual law-breakers.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: UK's Most Hated Woman?.
programme.desc: The documentary about people on benefits meets a whole new group - those who are living quite comfortably on little money. They include Worcester woman Susanne, who gave up work eight months ago due to a heart problem and now claims £1,600 a month. Eager to live the celebrity lifestyle, she drives a £28,000 car and hit the headlines in January after making an unsuccessful claim on a £33million National Lottery ticket. Others featured are Carl from the Isle of Sheppey, who spends most of his time and money at his local pub, and Bradford man Craig, who gave up his job two years ago to be a full-time single dad to his seven-year-old son.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Single mum Debra has a number of failed relationships behind her and now wants to buy her own home. When the chance of a part in a movie comes up, she hopes this will be the big break she is hoping for. Maidstone man Anthony thinks his epilepsy is putting off potential employers, Hull carer Anne Marie says she does not receive enough money to take her granddaughter out for day trips, while Steven from Southend spends his benefits helping to feed the homeless.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A man living in Cumbria takes issue with his neighbour's habit of letting his menagerie of chickens, cockerels, parrots and other birds freely wander along a residential road, and is even more disturbed by the fact that some of his fellow residents don't seem to have a problem with it. A former urban couple who moved to a rural valley in north Wales to breed horses enter open conflict with the owners of a nearby yurt business, whose fireworks parties spooked one of their prized beasts, resulting in an injury. Finally, a Romanian woman finds herself subject to abuse when she tries to set up a new home with her daughter in Wigan.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: The observational documentary shedding light on residential disputes concludes with an insight into how suburban feuds can breed anger, suspicion and fear, and cause people to resort to subterfuge to get their way. Among the stories highlighted are that of Leslie, whose neighbours began capturing his activities on film, convinced that his trade business was illegal, and Phil, who was assigned a restraining order after his ex-mayor neighbour made recordings that proved he was harassing her. Also featured are two tales in which old friendships were ruined when certain parties resorted to breaching each other's privacy and round-the-clock surveillance.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: The buy-to-let documentary series revisits some of the cases featured in the show's first run, including Demetrios and Miriam, who sought help from Lewisham Council after chilly conditions and unusual bathroom and kitchen arrangements in their south London flat became intolerable. Gareth and Joanna of Phoenix Community Care detail their ongoing battle against squatters who took up residence in the building they intended to turn into a community centre for vulnerable children, and Peterborough City Council's Housing officer Peter returns to a property deemed a category 1 fire hazard by the fire service - and therefore unfit for human habitation.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Big Family Bust Up.
programme.desc: One-off edition in which the High Court enforcement agents are caught in the crossfire of three bitter family disputes, including a debt-dodging man who pushes his panic-stricken mother over the edge. Plus, a family booted onto the streets at night by a ruthless aunt, and a man who won't engage with the agents and loses his car.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents try to recover more than £12,000 owed by a jeweller to one of his suppliers, but as the tension mounts, the debtor violently lashes out at one of the officers. Meanwhile, agents in London chase up more than £5,000 owed by a tenant to her former landlord for rent arrears, and also attempt to retrieve over £6,000 owed by a property developer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team is forced to establish whether the gunning down of a man outside the Vietnamese Consulate is an isolated incident or a terrorist attack, facing a race against time to ensure the safety of delegates at an upcoming international conference. Crime drama, guest starring Dan Lauria (The Wonder Years).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the weekend's games in the Championship, including Burton Albion v Leeds United at the Pirelli Stadium, Sheffield Wednesday v Derby County at Hillsborough and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Blackburn Rovers at Molineux.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the weekend's games in League One and Two, including Milton Keynes Dons v Sheffield United and Exeter City v Morecambe.(n)

programme.title: The Funny Thing About..
programme.sub-title: The Funny Side of Growing Up.
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas teams up with a variety of well-known British stars to take an irreverent look back at the process of growing into adulthood. Suzanne Shaw and Megan McKenna offer up tales of embarrassing accidents up against a tree and behind a sofa respectively, while Ian `H' Watkins explains how he made Gary Barlow suffer a similar misfortune. Plus, an account from a celebrity whose mother used their head to crack eggs, another whose treasure hunt unearthed a secret stash of condoms, and one who went to school with a boy nicknamed `Hard-on Harvey'.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Bigmouths
programme.desc: Ian Stone takes aim at current affairs of the past seven days, with help from Zoe Lyons, Geoff Norcott, Ian Moore and Jo Caulfield. Plus, Rory Bremner makes a guest appearance.(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A naive Texan aims to become a New York City gigolo, a forms a mutually-beneficial friendship with a hustler who takes him under his wing. When the hustler's health starts to fail, the Texan turns one final trick in a selfless bid to take his new friend to Miami(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realise that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: This drama is based on Laurel Hester a New Jersey police lieutenant (Julianne Moore) and her domestic partner Stacie Andree (Ellen Page) who battle to have pension benefits from Hester pass on to her partner after she is diagnosed with terminal lung cancer. Directed by Peter Sollett. Also stars Steve Carell, Michael Shannon, Josh Charles, Luke Grimes, Mary Birdsong and Gabriel Luna(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: In Joel Schumacher's taut thriller, told in real time, cynical, smarmy PR man Stu Shepard picks up a ringing phone in a booth in a busy New York street to find a killer on the line. Armed with a high-powered sniper's rifle, the anonymous caller soon proves his prowess and presents Shepard with a choice: convince the police of his story before they shoot him or drop the phone and be shot. His only hope lies in self-abasement and facing up to the truths of his life(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley Gibson is frustrated with his boring life, dead end job and unfaithful girlfriend. Everything changes when a sexy and dangerous woman named Fox walks into his life to tell Wesley that his father was an assassin. Fox soon initiates Wesley into an ancient band of killers called the Fraternity, led by the mysterious Sloan. The former weakling is transformed into a skilled assassin by his new associates, but is his new life really as it seems?(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Rockstar Games' double-gunned action franchise comes to the big screen thanks to director John Moore (The Omen) and Mark Wahlberg, who embodies the title character of Max Payne, a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city. Mila Kunis and Chris O'Donnell head up the supporting cast, with Beau Thorne adapting the screenplay for the 20th Century Fox production(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: In this film adaptation of the classic video-game, humans must protect their peaceful realm of Azeroth from the invading Orc Warriors(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy starring Kevin Costner about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. An amphibious loner, 'The Mariner', tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Though ostensibly a family-oriented outing, Ivan Reitman's Kindergarten Cop ensures that fans of star Arnold Schwarzenegger's action films won't be disappointed by pumping up the Cop half of the equation to a surprisingly high degree. Schwarzenegger stars as John Kimble, an L.A. cop who learns that the ex-wife and son of his drug-dealer quarry Crisp (Richard Tyson) are living in secrecy in small-town Oregon. Kimble is partnered with Phoebe (Pamela Reed), a former teacher, who is slated to begin undercover work at the school where Crisp's ex is suspected of working under an assumed identity. However, Phoebe becomes ill, forcing rough, gruff Kimble to take over the kindergarten class instead(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kristen Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: Maze Runner: Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas and the other Gladers journey across a brutal, obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the mysterious organisation known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Dominic Toretto and his tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse in this terrifying tale of the supernatural(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bob and Walt are inseparable - they're conjoined twins. But things start to come apart when Walt pursues his Hollywood dream(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: Director Guy Ritchie heads back to the London underworld in this crime comedy starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton. Wilkinson plays Lenny Cole, a Russian mobster who orchestrates a lucrative real estate scam. Greed is the universal language, and everyone from Cole to street-smart criminal One Two (Gerard Butler) and corrupt accountant Stella (Thandie Newton) seems to speak it fluently. Jeremy Piven and Chris Ludacris Bridges co-star(n)

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Jason Statham pays an ex-Special Forces officer now living in France. He has a new career - he will, for the right amount, take anything anywhere. His three rules are no changes to the plan; no real names; no opening of the package. Until one package starts moving... Inside is Shu Qi and despite delivering her to the unscrupulous Matt Schulze, when he discovers the broader picture of illegal people smuggling, his conscience gets the better of him and he begins to track down Schulze and his masters to rescue Qi(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: In the near future, professional racer Jensen Ames is set up for a crime he didn't commit and forced to take part in a deadly demolition derby to win his freedom(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: In this high-octane action sequel, hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover. The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: In this film adaptation of the classic video-game, humans must protect their peaceful realm of Azeroth from the invading Orc Warriors(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A naive Texan aims to become a New York City gigolo, a forms a mutually-beneficial friendship with a hustler who takes him under his wing. When the hustler's health starts to fail, the Texan turns one final trick in a selfless bid to take his new friend to Miami(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realise that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: This drama is based on Laurel Hester a New Jersey police lieutenant (Julianne Moore) and her domestic partner Stacie Andree (Ellen Page) who battle to have pension benefits from Hester pass on to her partner after she is diagnosed with terminal lung cancer. Directed by Peter Sollett. Also stars Steve Carell, Michael Shannon, Josh Charles, Luke Grimes, Mary Birdsong and Gabriel Luna(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: In Joel Schumacher's taut thriller, told in real time, cynical, smarmy PR man Stu Shepard picks up a ringing phone in a booth in a busy New York street to find a killer on the line. Armed with a high-powered sniper's rifle, the anonymous caller soon proves his prowess and presents Shepard with a choice: convince the police of his story before they shoot him or drop the phone and be shot. His only hope lies in self-abasement and facing up to the truths of his life(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley Gibson is frustrated with his boring life, dead end job and unfaithful girlfriend. Everything changes when a sexy and dangerous woman named Fox walks into his life to tell Wesley that his father was an assassin. Fox soon initiates Wesley into an ancient band of killers called the Fraternity, led by the mysterious Sloan. The former weakling is transformed into a skilled assassin by his new associates, but is his new life really as it seems?(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Rockstar Games' double-gunned action franchise comes to the big screen thanks to director John Moore (The Omen) and Mark Wahlberg, who embodies the title character of Max Payne, a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city. Mila Kunis and Chris O'Donnell head up the supporting cast, with Beau Thorne adapting the screenplay for the 20th Century Fox production(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: In this film adaptation of the classic video-game, humans must protect their peaceful realm of Azeroth from the invading Orc Warriors(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy starring Kevin Costner about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. An amphibious loner, 'The Mariner', tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Though ostensibly a family-oriented outing, Ivan Reitman's Kindergarten Cop ensures that fans of star Arnold Schwarzenegger's action films won't be disappointed by pumping up the Cop half of the equation to a surprisingly high degree. Schwarzenegger stars as John Kimble, an L.A. cop who learns that the ex-wife and son of his drug-dealer quarry Crisp (Richard Tyson) are living in secrecy in small-town Oregon. Kimble is partnered with Phoebe (Pamela Reed), a former teacher, who is slated to begin undercover work at the school where Crisp's ex is suspected of working under an assumed identity. However, Phoebe becomes ill, forcing rough, gruff Kimble to take over the kindergarten class instead(n)

programme.title: The Change-Up
programme.desc: Wedding Crashers director David Dobkin and The Hangover writers Jon Lucas and Scott Moore unite for this farcical body-swap bromance starring Ryan Reynolds and Jason Bateman. Family man Dave Lockwood and feckless bachelor Mitch Planko are long-time friends whose identities are magically switched after they express their envy of each other's lives. Cue plenty of below the belt humour as the pair struggle to cope with their new roles and responsibilities, including what happens in the bedroom between Mitch and Dave's wife Jamie. Body swap films are always about the protagonists learning life lessons and developing empathy, and no new ground is broken here, but there are charismatic performances and plenty of laughs on the road to the inevitable restoration of the status quo(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Plus, Jeremy puts the new 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, while The Fall and The X-Files star Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the latest Jaguar F-type R and Eagle's modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the new version of the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta takes part in an undercover FBI operation that ends in a mass arrest. But when one of the mobsters escapes he enlists Boyle's help in tracking him down. Captain Holt tests the squad's patience with practice drills in which Sgt Jeffords plays different roles, while Gina pleads with Boyle to keep a secret. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt is taken by surprise when his long-time nemesis, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch (guest star Kyra Sedgwick), arrives to carry out an inspection of his precinct. programme.title: Melissa & Joey

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben's attempts to flirt with a student who goes to Riley's new British boyfriend's college go awry, causing Philip to potentially face losing both his job and his visa. Meanwhile, Tucker puts on a fake English accent in order to attract women.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: A horrified Ben realises that he once dated Tucker's new girlfriend, and he soon becomes convinced that she only got together with Tucker to get back at him for their terrible break-up. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted considers dating his tattoo-removal doctor, but his friends warn him of the consequences of going out with regular acquaintances - an experience from which they have all suffered in the past. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily and Marshall celebrate St Patrick's Day by staying at home and playing board games - but Barney persuades Ted to join him for a wild night on the town. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry and Erica forget to buy Beverly a Mother's Day gift and make last-minute `Mom Coupons' instead. Understandably hurt, Beverly gets her revenge by cashing in every coupon they have made in one go. Adam yearns to go to a summer camp for junior astronauts and accuses his father of crushing his dreams when he isn't keen to give permission.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry's favourite shirt is hated by both his mother Beverly and his girlfriend Lainey, so they hatch a plan together to destroy it. However, once the shirt goes missing, Barry asks Adam and Erica to investigate. Murray decides to tear down the family tree house, leaving Adam distraught.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicist's mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicist's favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney discovers Ted has been knocked over by a taxi and rushes to the hospital to see him. On the way, he is hit by a bus and breaks all the bones in his body. Stella discovers her boyfriend was planning to split up with her before the accident, and decides to end the relationship herself.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted realises he knows very little about Stella when he puts peanuts in her dinner, unaware she is allergic to them, and nearly kills her. Meanwhile, Lily helps Barney in his efforts to impress Robin. American sitcom, with Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to add a touch of romance to an event when he invites his girlfriend Sophia (Eva Longoria) to the precinct's work trip, along with Amy's boyfriend, Teddy (Kyle Bornheimer). Meanwhile, Charles is keen to help Holt with his anniversary breakfast, and Rosa refuses to admit to Terry and Gina that she is unwell. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Doug Judy (Craig Robinson) is returned to custody after scamming Jake and Rosa in a previous encounter, but Captain Holt offers him a plea deal when he reveals he knows the location of a notorious drug dealer. Meanwhile, Gina and Boyle become concerned about their parents' relationship, and Santiago makes Holt a Christmas gift. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam gets between Murray and Marvin when they go without him to the Philadelphia Thanksgiving Day parade to see KITT from TV show Knight Rider. Beverly invites Lainey and Bill to Thanksgiving dinner so that Barry won't split his time between two households, but her plans soon go awry. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry makes fun of Adam for taking part in a school musical production, but when he finds out that Adam and Lainey have been cast in roles that require them to kiss, he tries to sabotage it by joining the stage crew. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon returns to Texas in disgrace when he discovers his friends tampered with the Arctic expedition data after growing tired of his quest for a scientific breakthrough. Elsewhere, Leonard becomes frustrated as constant interruptions hamper his attempts to woo Penny.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Kathy and Zoe return for Amy's funeral but there is still bad blood between them. Hunter saves the day for Peri, and Sienna helps Warren with another criminal plan, but could Prince's interference cause a big problem?.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The cop comedy returns after a mid-season break. When one of the precincts in the area must be closed, an evaluation process takes place. The squad is confident about its assessment - until it turns out the auditor is Santiago's ex-boyfriend Teddy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.title: Taken 2
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Bryan Mills and his ex-wife Lenore are taken hostage in Istanbul by an Albanian gangster, whose son Bryan killed while bringing down a kidnapping ring. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace and Famke Janssen.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuart's comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls' trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. programme.title: Tattoo Fixers

programme.sub-title: If You Can't Stand the Heat.

Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel and Joe are shocked to discover that Lennox's boyfriend Aidan spent the night in her bedroom, but Joe is even more taken aback at Mel's easy-going reaction to the situation. Meanwhile, Ryder's girlfriend Holly declares that it is time for him to start shaving.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: When Joe starts to run Mel's finances, he becomes convinced that her credit card statement reveals that she is having an affair with a married man. Meanwhile, Lennox tries to get along with her friend's new date - until he reveals that he has a crush on her and Ryder tries to decide what to get Holly for her birthday.(n)

programme.desc: Adam has a birthday sleepover, during which his friend Garry shares out some of his father's home-brewed beer and makes everyone sick. Meanwhile, Barry and Erica want a new CD player, but Murray tells them he will only buy one for them if they write the greatest song ever.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly discovers Adam is failing in Spanish class, and immediately blames his teacher. However, when she arranges for him to receive extra tuition, her plan backfires.(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Jess befriends a new girl at school, and the pair begin to create their own imaginary kingdom in a secret place in the woods to escape the difficulties of their real lives. Unfortunately, a tragedy threatens to bring their fantasy world to an end. Drama based on Katherine Paterson's novel, starring Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel and Robert Patrick.(n)

programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church. Edited for language.(n)

programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin.(n)

programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howard's mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the seventh series finale, Sheldon becomes upset about his career, the destruction of the comic-book store and Leonard and Penny's future living arrangements. Elsewhere, Howard is unable to keep hold of a carer for his mother. Comedy, staring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Amy are forced to take an unexpected road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon after his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuart's relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadette's workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonard's secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pair's squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang goes to a bar and runs into Penny's old boyfriend Zack, while Bernadette is left to spend the evening with Sheldon when she cannot go wine tasting with the others. Elsewhere, things do not go to plan when Raj introduces his new girlfriend, Claire. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim Levenstein and his old friends return to their home town for a high-school reunion. Struck by how much their lives have changed, they set out to relive the sexual misadventures of their adolescence, but only end up making bigger fools of themselves than they did as teenagers. Comedy sequel to the American Pie movies, starring Jason Biggs and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Honey Badgers - Masters of Mayhem.
programme.desc: Although barely a foot tall, the honey badger has a reputation as one of the most fearless animals in the world, attacking just about anything from venomous snakes to adult lions. This documentary follows a scientist, a beekeeper and a conservationist in South Africa as they set out to discover if the creature is really as fearsome as it is made out to be.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.sub-title: The Birth and Death of the Planet.
programme.desc: Examining the creation of the Earth 4.5 billion years ago, and what could become of it in the future.(n)

programme.title: Why Planes Crash
programme.desc: Investigating how nine passengers were sucked out of a United Airlines 747 in 1989 when a cargo door exploded over the Pacific.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough chooses the 10 endangered animals from around the world that he would most like to save from extinction, explaining why these creatures are so important and highlighting the work of biologists helping to keep them alive. His list includes Darwin's frog, the Sumatran rhino, Priam's birdwing butterfly and the black lion tamarin.(n)
